TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed TransformerInfoCollection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection

Docs.summary: Contains a collection of objects. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfoCollection> class allows you to programmatically access and modify the `transformers` section of the `webParts` section of a configuration file.
<xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfo> objects, as part of a <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfoCollection>, specify custom classes that extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer> class. These transformer classes act as bridges between connected Web Parts, translating data sent by a connection provider into something that the connection consumer can accept.
## Examples The following configuration file excerpt shows how to declaratively specify values for several properties of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfoCollection> class.
``` <system.web> <webParts> <transformers> <clear /> <remove name="RowToKeysTransformer" /> <add name="RowToFieldTransformer" type="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.RowToFieldTransformer" /> <add name="RowToFilterTransformer" type="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.RowToFilterTransformer" /> <add name="RowToParametersTransformer" type="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.RowToParametersTransformer" /> </transformers> </webParts> </system.web> ```
The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfoCollection> class. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection/CS/usingwebpartssection.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection/VB/usingwebpartssection.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfoCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system. The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection.Transformers%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection> class always contains an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfoCollection> type. Use this instance, rather than creating your own.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfo transformerInfo) cil managed

Docs.param: A object to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds a object to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The collection must not already contain a <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfo> object with the same <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfo.Name%2A> property value.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfoCollection.Add%2A> method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection/CS/usingwebpartssection.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection/VB/usingwebpartssection.vb#5)]

Docs.exception:
The object to add already exists in the collection.
\- or -
The collection is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all objects from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method removes all <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfo> objects from the collection and inserts a `clear` element into the `transformers` collection of the `webParts` section of the configuration file.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfoCollection.Clear%2A> method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection/CS/usingwebpartssection.cs#9)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection/VB/usingwebpartssection.vb#9)]

public System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfo this[int index] { get; set; }

Docs.param: The index of a object in the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets or sets the object at the specified index location.
Docs.value: The object at the specified index, or if there is no object at that index.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfoCollection.Item%28System.Int32%29> property overwrites the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfo> object if it already exists; otherwise, a new object is created and added to the collection.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfoCollection.Item%2A> property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Remove(string s) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of a object to remove from the collection.
Docs.summary: Removes the object with the passed property value from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method removes a <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfo> object from the collection and, if the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfo> object is defined in a higher-level configuration file, inserts a `remove` element into the `transformers` collection of the `webParts` section of the configuration file.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TransformerInfoCollection.Remove%2A> method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection> class.
